intro: Ploiarium sessile, commonly known as the sessile ploiarium, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and slender, leafless stems that often grow close to the ground. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in woodland areas. Its flowers are usually greenish-white in color and lack the typical aromatic compounds found in many other members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
